User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:8.0.1) Gecko/20111121 Firefox/8.0.1 SeaMonkey/2.5
Build ID: 20111121023255

Steps to reproduce:

Running on KDE, with my window focus policy set to 'focus follows mouse'.  I have a large enough set of bookmarks that when I am navigating the Bookmarks menu sometimes they end up outside of the browser window.   When I select one of those...


Actual results:

if the window underneath where my cursor is not a seamonkey window then nothing happens (the bookmark menu disappears).  If there is a seamonkey window underneath my cursor when I select the bookmark it gets opened in that window, even if that window is not the window I opened the bookmark menu in.  


Expected results:

Seamonkey should open the bookmark in the browser window I initially opened the bookmark menu in.

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to long from comment #0)

> if the window underneath where my cursor is not a seamonkey window then
> nothing happens (the bookmark menu disappears).  If there is a seamonkey
> window underneath my cursor when I select the bookmark it gets opened in
> that window, even if that window is not the window I opened the bookmark
> menu in.  

I know this as a long-standing bug which exists since the first SM version2 release, as far as I remember it was not in SM version1 and was also never in Firefox.

I can, however, not confirm the above described result when the cursor is not above a Seamonkey window, in this case I get the expected result.

And FWIW, the problem is not Linux-only, you get it also on Windows when you configure this to 'focus follows mouse' (what I usually have  ;-).
